text: Luk Wu Tsuen () is an area of Lantau Island in Hong Kong, home to several Buddhist monasteries. The place was named as such since deer could be found there in the past and the landscape looks like a lake.Historic Building Appraisal: Fat Chuen Chi ==References== ==External links== * An Oral History of Luk Wu * Draft Luk Wu and Keung Shan Outline Zoning Plan approved, September 18, 2015 Category:Lantau Island
title: Luk Wu
